Text.Page: You found someone's journal. Apparently, this was Hennika's diary, when she was still a child.

Detrian is gone. He made a wooden doll for me, and I still keep it in my bed.
I feel strange. Detrian’s stuff is here, but he is gone.
His clothes are still here. His sword is here. But Detrian is not here.

I wonder what happens to people when they die. I wonder what happened to my brother.Open the journal."Looks like Hennika was crying when she wrote this."

I want to be grown up like my brother and save people. I practice swordfighting everyday.
Every time I practice, I think of Detrian. It makes me sad.
Detrian once told me that, after I grow up, I can use a real sword, not a practice sword made of wood.

I miss my brother."Hm...there's more."

I made a friend today.

I was heading to the hill where Detrian and I used to go. Suddenly, a huge beast jumped out of the bushes.
I turned and ran as fast as I could. I accidently dropped Detrian’s sword, but I had no time to pick it up.
The beast came after me, and cornered me in a dead end.
But the beast didn’t kill me. He had something in his mouth, and dropped it right in front of me.

It was Detrian’s sword!
I picked it up, but the monster just stared at me.
Then strangely, I wasn't afraid anymore."Hennika made friends with a monster?"

I was a good girl today.

I found a baby bird in the woods.
I picked it up, and Argog put me on his shoulder so we could put it back in its nest.
The tree was tall, but it didn’t stop us from returning the baby to his mother."She must have been so lonely."
